meanings.definition: to strike or hit with a firm blow
meanings.sent1: He tried to smite the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The knight raised his sword high, ready to smite his enemy.
meanings.sent3: The chef's knife seemed to smite the vegetables effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to smite the old tree with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punch was so powerful, it could smite his opponent in one blow.

meanings.definition: to afflict or attack with a powerful force
meanings.sent1: The flu virus can smite a person's health quickly.
meanings.sent2: The dragon unleashed its fiery breath to smite the village.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm seemed to smite everyone without umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news seemed to smite her heart with sadness.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake's tremors could smite buildings to the ground in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks never failed to smite the audience.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the sunset seemed to smite her with awe.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's adorable antics always managed to smite a smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: The actor's performance was so moving, it could smite the viewers to tears.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece had the power to smite all who gazed upon it.
